Apple___Apple_scab: Spray fungicide (like mancozeb or captan) every 10 to 14 days in rainy season. Collect and burn fallen leaves. Do not water from the top.
Apple___Black_rot: Cut and throw away infected fruits and branches. Spray copper fungicide after pruning. Keep orchard clean and remove weeds.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust: Do not plant near juniper trees. Remove infected leaves. Spray fungicide such as myclobutanil during early growth.
Apple___healthy: Tree is healthy. Keep soil fertile with compost, water regularly, and prune branches to keep airflow.
Blueberry___healthy: Plant is healthy. Mulch around the plant to keep moisture, water regularly, and protect from birds.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: White powder on leaves – spray sulfur-based fungicide every 7 to 10 days. Cut off diseased leaves and make space between trees.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy: Tree is fine. Give balanced fertilizer in spring and water deeply once a week.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray: Plant resistant corn seeds. Rotate crops. Spray fungicide like strobilurin when first symptoms appear.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_: Grow rust-resistant seeds. Remove weeds. Spray fungicide such as azoxystrobin if disease spreads fast.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Use resistant hybrids. Rotate with non-corn crops. Spray fungicide at 6 to 8 leaf stage if infection is seen.
Corn_(maize)___healthy: Corn is healthy. Apply nitrogen fertilizer in stages and water during dry spells.
Grape___Black_rot: Remove infected leaves and grapes. Spray fungicide (captan, mancozeb) before and after flowering. Prune vines to increase airflow.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): Prune diseased wood. Avoid pruning wounds during rainy season. Apply protective fungicides after pruning.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Remove diseased leaves. Spray copper fungicide. Keep vineyard clean and free from weeds.
Grape___healthy: Plant is healthy. Fertilize with organic compost and water during dry season.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): No full cure. Remove and destroy sick trees. Control psyllid insects with sprays. Plant resistant rootstocks if available.
Peach___Bacterial_spot: Spray copper fungicide after bloom. Use disease-free seeds or saplings. Avoid wetting leaves while watering.
Peach___healthy: Healthy tree. Water deeply once in 7 to 10 days and give potassium-rich fertilizer.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot: Use disease-free seeds. Spray copper fungicide weekly. Rotate crops and avoid planting peppers after tomatoes.
Pepper,_bell___healthy: Healthy crop. Give compost before flowering and maintain soil moisture.
Potato___Early_blight: Remove and destroy infected leaves. Spray fungicide (chlorothalonil, mancozeb) at first sign. Rotate crops with cereals.
Potato___Late_blight: Spray fungicide (metalaxyl or mancozeb) at 7-day intervals. Remove sick plants quickly. Avoid overhead irrigation.
Potato___healthy: Potato is fine. Plant certified seed tubers and hill soil around plants for protection.
Raspberry___healthy: Plant is healthy. Prune canes after harvest and remove weeds.
Soybean___healthy: Crop is healthy. Rotate crops, add nitrogen-fixing bacteria, and control weeds.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: White powdery spots – spray sulfur or neem oil. Plant resistant squash types. Give proper space between plants.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Cut off infected leaves. Spray fungicide (captan). Water plants at soil level, not on leaves.
Strawberry___healthy: Healthy plant. Mulch with straw, keep weeds away, and water regularly.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Spray copper fungicide weekly. Avoid touching wet plants. Rotate crops every season.
Tomato___Early_blight: Remove yellowing leaves. Spray fungicide (mancozeb, chlorothalonil) at first signs. Rotate with non-solanaceae crops.
Tomato___Late_blight: Spray fungicide (metalaxyl or mancozeb) every 7 days. Remove and burn infected plants. Improve airflow by staking plants.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Keep greenhouse ventilated. Remove infected leaves. Spray fungicide if infection spreads.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Remove affected leaves. Spray fungicide (chlorothalonil) every 7 to 10 days. Avoid overhead irrigation.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider: Spray insecticidal soap or neem oil. Keep leaves moist. Release natural predators like ladybugs.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Spray fungicide (mancozeb, chlorothalonil). Do not wet leaves at night. Rotate crops.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: No cure. Pull out and burn infected plants. Control whiteflies with insecticides. Plant resistant tomato varieties.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: No cure. Use virus-free seeds. Disinfect tools and hands before touching plants. Remove sick plants immediately.
Tomato___healthy: Tomato is healthy. Water regularly, fertilize with compost, and tie plants to stakes.
